TextBody:
Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
 https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download  https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9zdXBwb3J0X3Rvb2wvU3VwcG9ydFRvb2xfd2luLnppcA==&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=Wit3VFNKVTFqNnY2emxuL1o2ZkV6YXlEcEtqVldKUWx4RWhVWkVmZjJ2cz0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9lcHBfY29sbGVjdF9kcGlfdG9vbC56aXA=&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=MENhQmx5STJ0cHR4US82QlZMbGNtck9GZThid1V2ZXZSUkhYSEVab09VTT0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9zdXBwb3J0X3Rvb2wvU3VwcG9ydFRvb2xfd2luLnppcA==&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=Wit3VFNKVTFqNnY2emxuL1o2ZkV6YXlEcEtqVldKUWx4RWhVWkVmZjJ2cz0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9lcHBfY29sbGVjdF9kcGlfdG9vbC56aXA=&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=MENhQmx5STJ0cHR4US82QlZMbGNtck9GZThid1V2ZXZSUkhYSEVab09VTT0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

TextBody:
Hello,

The dev noticed in the logs you have "*.whatsapp.com" added to the allowlist.
This will interfere with "*web.whatsapp.com" from the denylist.
Can you please remove the allowlist and check if the website is blocked?

Kind regards
__________________

Netwrix Endpoint Protector

sophospsmartbannerend

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

Dear Satish,

I appreciate you taking the time to share your concerns, and I completely understand how frustrating this situation must be for you and your team. Ensuring that you can fully utilize Endpoint Protector is our top priority, and we regret that this has been a prolonged and challenging experience.

I want to acknowledge the efforts our support team has put in over the past months to assist with the different issues that arose, working closely with your team and Satcom Infotech team to troubleshoot and resolve them. I also recognize that despite the efforts, the challenges have persisted, which is understandably frustrating.

Regarding the latest issue, we're currently awaiting the confirmation from your team if "*.whatsapp.com" is part of both a denylist and an allowlist (as this is showing up in the last set of logs received from your team) and the conclusion after removing it from the allowlist. Furthermore, it would help us understand exactly what other solutions are part of your technology stack (VPN, antivirus, Secure Web Gateways). Sharing with us the exact names of these solutions would be extremely helpful.

Your experience matters to us, and we truly appreciate your patience and partnership as we work through this.

Best regards,

Oana Nemes

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9zdXBwb3J0X3Rvb2wvU3VwcG9ydFRvb2xfd2luLnppcA==&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=Wit3VFNKVTFqNnY2emxuL1o2ZkV6YXlEcEtqVldKUWx4RWhVWkVmZjJ2cz0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Frhar:ref

Dear Netwrix Team,

As per your suggestion, we have removed the whatsapp and skype from allowlist and it is working.
The customer, is also facing issues with the below points as discussed earlier.


  1.  Personal gmail is logging in even though protection policy is applied to block personal logins in gmail.
  2.  Cloudflare getting blocked due to Netwrix.

The issue reported by the customer mentions that the policy are intermittently getting disabled. Hence the policies are sometimes working as expected and sometimes aren’t. There is also a few more issues which customer has reported as getting disabled intermittently.
I request you to check the actual issue holistically instead of addressing each issues one by one.
Since the logs we send every time while recreating the issue is reported as having no logs indicating the same, is it possible for your engineer to collect log themselves while the issue is recreated.

[signature_2251198256]

Dear Satish,

I appreciate you taking the time to share your concerns, and I completely understand how frustrating this situation must be for you and your team. Ensuring that you can fully utilize Endpoint Protector is our top priority, and we regret that this has been a prolonged and challenging experience.

I want to acknowledge the efforts our support team has put in over the past months to assist with the different issues that arose, working closely with your team and Satcom Infotech team to troubleshoot and resolve them. I also recognize that despite the efforts, the challenges have persisted, which is understandably frustrating.

Regarding the latest issue, we're currently awaiting the confirmation from your team if "*.whatsapp.com<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=whatsapp.com&u=aHR0cDovL3doYXRzYXBwLmNvbQ==&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=V0xzZUpiTVRycVBSLzhZbE1VRGhnWmZqVnBSRlYrRmxPQ1NrKzY3bmpGQT0=&h=7e44b087903749abaada642b18fc5915&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVavUr0Lu5XKc642ZlOI2576OhRaYQDaAPCxvUD73ctstA>" is part of both a denylist and an allowlist (as this is showing up in the last set of logs received from your team) and the conclusion after removing it from the allowlist. Furthermore, it would help us understand exactly what other solutions are part of your technology stack (VPN, antivirus, Secure Web Gateways). Sharing with us the exact names of these solutions would be extremely helpful.

Your experience matters to us, and we truly appreciate your patience and partnership as we work through this.

Best regards,

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9zdXBwb3J0X3Rvb2wvU3VwcG9ydFRvb2xfd2luLnppcA==&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=Wit3VFNKVTFqNnY2emxuL1o2ZkV6YXlEcEtqVldKUWx4RWhVWkVmZjJ2cz0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9lcHBfY29sbGVjdF9kcGlfdG9vbC56aXA=&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=MENhQmx5STJ0cHR4US82QlZMbGNtck9GZThid1V2ZXZSUkhYSEVab09VTT0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards

The issue reported by the customer mentions that the policy are intermittently getting disabled. Hence the policies are sometimes working as expected and sometimes aren’t. There is also a few more issues which customer has reported as getting disabled intermittently.

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Frhar:ref

Hello Sidharth,

We completely understand that it's frustrating when policies don't seem to apply as expected. We want to resolve this as efficiently as possible for J M BAXI GROUP and also for Satcom Infotech.
From our experience, when multiple issues are grouped into one report/ ticket it may slow down resolutions because different teams may need to investigate different aspects. If we separate each specific symptom or issue into its own ticket, we can ensure that the right experts address them simultaneously rather then sequentially - think  of it like a doctor's visit: if you come in saying you feel unwell, they'll ask about each symptom separately to get to the root cause faster/ direct you to the right specialist/s. The same applies here - by braking things down, we can diagnose and fix each issue more efficiently.

The support team already asked for availability to look at both issues that you described earlier (and that are independent from the .whatsapp.com related issue that was confirmed solved) - this time we'll keep these both into the current ticket, but moving further, may we agree to get each issue reported into a dedicated ticket?

Looking forward to hearing from you,
Oana

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9zdXBwb3J0X3Rvb2wvU3VwcG9ydFRvb2xfd2luLnppcA==&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=Wit3VFNKVTFqNnY2emxuL1o2ZkV6YXlEcEtqVldKUWx4RWhVWkVmZjJ2cz0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9lcHBfY29sbGVjdF9kcGlfdG9vbC56aXA=&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=MENhQmx5STJ0cHR4US82QlZMbGNtck9GZThid1V2ZXZSUkhYSEVab09VTT0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9zdXBwb3J0X3Rvb2wvU3VwcG9ydFRvb2xfd2luLnppcA==&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=Wit3VFNKVTFqNnY2emxuL1o2ZkV6YXlEcEtqVldKUWx4RWhVWkVmZjJ2cz0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.

Hello Sidharth,

We completely understand that it's frustrating when policies don't seem to apply as expected. We want to resolve this as efficiently as possible for J M BAXI GROUP and also for Satcom Infotech.
From our experience, when multiple issues are grouped into one report/ ticket it may slow down resolutions because different teams may need to investigate different aspects. If we separate each specific symptom or issue into its own ticket, we can ensure that the right experts address them simultaneously rather then sequentially - think  of it like a doctor's visit: if you come in saying you feel unwell, they'll ask about each symptom separately to get to the root cause faster/ direct you to the right specialist/s. The same applies here - by braking things down, we can diagnose and fix each issue more efficiently.

The support team already asked for availability to look at both issues that you described earlier (and that are independent from the .whatsapp.com related issue that was confirmed solved) - this time we'll keep these both into the current ticket, but moving further, may we agree to get each issue reported into a dedicated ticket?

Looking forward to hearing from you,
Oana

Dear Satish,

I appreciate you taking the time to share your concerns, and I completely understand how frustrating this situation must be for you and your team. Ensuring that you can fully utilize Endpoint Protector is our top priority, and we regret that this has been a prolonged and challenging experience.

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9zdXBwb3J0X3Rvb2wvU3VwcG9ydFRvb2xfd2luLnppcA==&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=Wit3VFNKVTFqNnY2emxuL1o2ZkV6YXlEcEtqVldKUWx4RWhVWkVmZjJ2cz0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9lcHBfY29sbGVjdF9kcGlfdG9vbC56aXA=&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=MENhQmx5STJ0cHR4US82QlZMbGNtck9GZThid1V2ZXZSUkhYSEVab09VTT0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9zdXBwb3J0X3Rvb2wvU3VwcG9ydFRvb2xfd2luLnppcA==&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=Wit3VFNKVTFqNnY2emxuL1o2ZkV6YXlEcEtqVldKUWx4RWhVWkVmZjJ2cz0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip<https://eu-west-1.protection.sophos.com?d=endpointprotector.com&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9kb3dubG9hZC5lbmRwb2ludHByb3RlY3Rvci5jb20vU3VwcG9ydF9maWxlcy9lcHBfY29sbGVjdF9kcGlfdG9vbC56aXA=&p=m&i=NjZjYzJjOTYzOTlhMzMwYjA2MDU2ZGFm&t=MENhQmx5STJ0cHR4US82QlZMbGNtck9GZThid1V2ZXZSUkhYSEVab09VTT0=&h=1b451aba6a864420a152c1bf79d048ba&s=AVNPUEhUT0NFTkNSWVBUSVbXGxHoidkgmstrHEF2BF3bzZYNVuyXh0Hsqsb3UeLc9g>
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

Kind regards

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

> 2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating
> system.
> 3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog
> box.

> 4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.

> directory of the C: drive.

> further.

Dear Netwrix Team, 

  

As per your suggestion, we have removed the whatsapp and skype from allowlist and it is working. 

The customer, is also facing issues with the below points as discussed earlier. 

  


	Personal gmail is logging in even though protection policy is applied to block personal logins in gmail. 
	Cloudflare getting blocked due to Netwrix. 


  

The issue reported by the customer mentions that the policy are intermittently getting disabled. Hence the policies are sometimes working as expected and sometimes aren’t. There is also a few more issues which customer has reported as getting disabled intermittently. 

I request you to check the actual issue holistically instead of addressing each issues one by one. 

Since the logs we send every time while recreating the issue is reported as having no logs indicating the same, is it possible for your engineer to collect log themselves while the issue is recreated.

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer

Dear Netwrix Team, 

  

As per your suggestion, we have removed the whatsapp and skype from allowlist and it is working. 

The customer, is also facing issues with the below points as discussed earlier. 

  

Personal gmail is logging in even though protection policy is applied to block personal logins in gmail. Cloudflare getting blocked due to Netwrix. 

  

The issue reported by the customer mentions that the policy are intermittently getting disabled. Hence the policies are sometimes working as expected and sometimes aren’t. There is also a few more issues which customer has reported as getting disabled intermittently. 

I request you to check the actual issue holistically instead of addressing each issues one by one. 

Since the logs we send every time while recreating the issue is reported as having no logs indicating the same, is it possible for your engineer to collect log themselves while the issue is recreated.

On Mon, Mar 24, 2025 at 2:07?AM Oana Nemes <Oana.Nemes@netwrix.com> wrote:

Dear Satish, 

I appreciate you taking the time to share your concerns, and I completely understand how frustrating this situation must be for you and your team. Ensuring that you can fully utilize Endpoint Protector is our top priority, and we regret that this has been a prolonged and challenging experience.

I want to acknowledge the efforts our support team has put in over the past months to assist with the different issues that arose, working closely with your team and Satcom Infotech team to troubleshoot and resolve them. I also recognize that despite the efforts, the challenges have persisted, which is understandably frustrating. 

Regarding the latest issue, we're currently awaiting the confirmation from your team if "*.whatsapp.com" is part of both a denylist and an allowlist (as this is showing up in the last set of logs received from your team) and the conclusion after removing it from the allowlist. Furthermore, it would help us understand exactly what other solutions are part of your technology stack (VPN, antivirus, Secure Web Gateways). Sharing with us the exact names of these solutions would be extremely helpful.

Your experience matters to us, and we truly appreciate your patience and partnership as we work through this.

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

Dear Netwrix Team, 

  

As per your suggestion, we have removed the whatsapp and skype from allowlist and it is working. 

The customer, is also facing issues with the below points as discussed earlier. 

  

Personal gmail is logging in even though protection policy is applied to block personal logins in gmail. Cloudflare getting blocked due to Netwrix. 

  

The issue reported by the customer mentions that the policy are intermittently getting disabled. Hence the policies are sometimes working as expected and sometimes aren’t. There is also a few more issues which customer has reported as getting disabled intermittently. 

I request you to check the actual issue holistically instead of addressing each issues one by one. 

Since the logs we send every time while recreating the issue is reported as having no logs indicating the same, is it possible for your engineer to collect log themselves while the issue is recreated.

sophospsmartbannerend

Hello,

We din not find any conclusive issue on the previous logs.
Can you please collect a new set of logs from a computer?
1. Download the archive to an empty folder at the following link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/support_tool/SupportTool_win.zip
2. Unzip the sub-archive corresponding to the client computer's operating system.
3. Double-click the EPPSupportTool_64 or _32.exe file. This opens a dialog box.
4.a. Select Create Log file and click Execute.
4.b. Select Create DPI Log file and click Execute.
This creates a file called eppclient.log and sslsplit.log in the root directory of the C: drive.
5. Right-click the EPP client and click "Update Policies Now".
6. Access the webpages that should have been blocked.
7. Open EPPSupportTool and click Export Files. This will copy files to the current folder.
8. Send me the created files (archived) so that we can investigate them further.

Also please run the extended log file for the DPI.
1. download https://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/epp_collect_dpi_tool.zip
2. Run the .bat file
3. The extended log should be on the desktop.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector
